main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported near Kadena Air Force Base in Okinawa on various dates in 1952, with witnesses observing luminous objects displaying erratic movements and characteristics.
interesting points: The sighting on 7th July 1952 involved a bright orange light in the sky near Kadena AFB, appearing for about 15 minutes and then disappearing without sound or a trail.
Witnesses observed multiple saucer-shaped objects at a high altitude, moving at 800 mph for 5 minutes on 14th July 1952.
Aircraft on a routine training mission sighted a luminous object on 11th July 1952, determined to be a meteor, with clear weather conditions and no radar confirmation.
An object described as a round bright light, approximately six inches in diameter, was observed hovering about 50 feet above the ground before accelerating rapidly and disappearing from sight.
Observations included sightings of silver, circular objects over Okinawa, with descriptions ruling out conventional aircraft or natural phenomena.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects (UFOs) displaying erratic movements and luminous characteristics
witnesses: military personnel, civilian employees, and off-duty personnel
